body.title: EPPO simple body content
body.p: The body content of an EPPO simple topic follows a body or section title element, as shown in the structure diagram "Body content in context."

section.title: Structure
section.p: Body content consists of text elements such as paragraphs and lists, figures, or other elements that would generally be presented as block components in a document. An EPPO simple body content group will have the structure shown in figure 2.

caption.p: Each component is optional and may appear any number of times, as indicated by the 0+ annotations.

section.p: Begin a body of content with one or more paragraphs, fragments, or fragment references, then follow with any mixture of those and other block elements:

li.p: A list, either ordered or unordered

section.title: Example
section.p: The following XML code forms the body content of the previous section.
section.codeblock:
A body of content consists of a sequence of elements such as paragraphs, lists, figures, or other elements that would generally be presented as block components in a document. An EPPO simple body content group will have the structure shown in figure 2.

EPPO simple body content structure

Each component is optional and may appear any number of times, as indicated by the 0+ annotations.

Begin a body of content with one or more paragraphs, fragments, or fragment references, then follow with any mixture of those and other block elements:

  • A subheading

  • A list, either ordered or unordered

  • A figure

  • A block of programming code
